intro: Licania niloi, commonly known as the Brazilian arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Licania niloi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a starchy food source.
